title: Lincolnshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: stolen boston stump collection box found in skatepark .
five arrested after crowle cash machine raid .
arriva rail north strike to go ahead next week .
re-opening of grantham a & e to be discussed next week .
major road safety summit held in grantham .
pedestrian dies after being hit by lorry near boston .

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it from me this week .
we 'll be back on monday from 08.00 with more news , sport , travel and weather from across lincolnshire .
before i go , here are five things we 've learned today :
author: David Sykes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather : a cloudy night in lincolnshire
text: thickening cloud this evening with rain arriving overnight .
the rain will turn heavy before easing later .
a wet start tomorrow , which should ease and brighten , only to become breezy and feeling cool .
sunday should be cool and dry with sunny spells .
author: Keeley Donovan
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: have you seen 14-year-old kieran ?
text: police are trying to make contact with 14-year-old kieran smith from mablethorpe who was reported missing from his home this morning .
it 's not known what he is currently wearing , but it 's thought that he may have travelled to the louth area .
lincolnshire police would like to speak to him to know that he is safe and well .

documents.title: mustard gas decontamination operation expected to be finished this month
text: a major decontamination operation of two sites near woodhall spa where dozens of mustard gas canisters were uncovered is `` likely to be completed in november '' , top military research specialists say .
porton down experts removed 150 canisters from roughton moor woods and stixwould lake after the discovery on 1 october .
two people sustained minor burns and three people who were arrested on sus of possessing a noxious substance were bailed .
some of the mustard gas leaked into the soil and work to test , remove and incinerate it is due to start this month .
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: train strikes herd of cows
text: rail services have been disrupted by a herd of cows - not these two - on the line at barrow upon soar .
many east midlands trains services between lincoln central and leicester have been cancelled and replacement buses are being provided .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lincolnshire roads 'have a long way to go ' - mp
text: more investment is needed in lincolnshire 's roads , according to transport minister john hayes .
mr hayes , who is also mp for south holland and the deepings , has been speaking at lincolnshire 's first ever road safety summit .
he said that historically governments have n't been bold enough in making infrastructure investments , but he said he will campaign for more investment in in-road investment in lincolnshire .
improvements often take too long to achieve , and there is more that can be done , he added .
mr hayes praised recent work on the a17 around peppermint junction , which `` has been long called for and taken a long time to do '' , but he said more can be done on the a16 .
specifically , he said there should be better links between spalding and peterborough where people access the a1 .
author: Rod Whiting
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: five jailed for total of 50 years after 'vile and horrific abuse '
text: four men and a woman have been jailed for a total of 50 years after subjecting a man to what police say was a `` sustained and vicious attack '' in gainsborough two years ago .
on 15 november 2015 , their victim was invited into a property and told to sit down before being punched , kicked and threatened at gunpoint .
he was handcuffed , hit with an extendable baton , and hit on his bare feet with a wooden stick .
the group then subjected the victim to waterboarding , which simulates drowning .
the five , all from gainsborough , were found guilty of false imprisonment .
all four males were also found guilty of assault by occasioning abh .
alvaras sepronas , 44 , of ashcroft road , was jailed for 18 years .

he was also found guilty of possessing firearms with intent to cause fear of violence , assault occasioning actual bodily harm , possession of drugs with intent to supply , possession of a prohibited weapon for discharge of noxious liquid/gas/electrical incapacitation device/thing and possession of prohibited ammunition .
jurgita makaroviene , 35 , of ashcroft road , was jailed for five years .
she was also found guilty of possession of drugs with intent to supply .
egidijus zukauskas , 44 , of parnell street , was jailed for 10 years .
vidas aleksandravicius , 50 , of parnell street , was jailed for 10 years .
he was also found guilty of imprisonment , assault occasioning actual bodily harm , assault occasioning actual bodily harm and possession of a controlled drug .
andrivs svetickas , 27 , of parnell street , was jailed for seven years .
he was also found guilty of assault occasioning actual bodily harm and possession of a controlled drug .

documents.title: five arrested after crowle cash machine raid
text: five men have been arrested on sus of theft after a cash machine was ripped from the wall at a shop in crowle , north lincolnshire .
the theft happened at about 04:00 this morning when several men ram raided mccoll 's newsagents on the high street using heavy lifting machinery .
a white mercedes car and a white ford transit van with its roof missing were also believed to be involved in the incident .
the van was later found burned out .
this was the scene in crowle a little earlier today :
author: Kimberley Metcalfe
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingrail strike to go ahead next week
text: a 24-hour strike by arriva rail north workers is to go ahead on wednesday 8 november .
the announcement by the rmt union comes after talks aimed at resolving a row over the role of guards `` collapsed '' .
the industrial action is over plans to make train doors driver-only operated .
rail companies have said this means the guard 's role will change but some workers believe safety procedures would be compromised .

documents.title: boston stump collection box found
text: an historic collection box which was stolen from boston stump this week has been found .
the box , parts of which date back to the 16th century , was stolen along with collection tins from the royal british legion 's poppy appeal and the raf association .
the rector , reverend alyson buxton , says she 's `` delighted '' and the team at the church is `` looking forward to it coming home .
`` it 's been slightly damaged but it should be able to be repaired , '' she says .
it 's believed to have been found by a police officer in a skatepark in the town .
the team at st botolph 's church has been looking through cctv and offered a £ 10 reward for the box to be returned .
it has been on a bit of a journey , tried a bit of skateboarding , looking a bit worse for wear , is having a night in the police cell - but is coming home . ''

documents.title: skegness beach transformed for motocross race
text: the skegness beach race is due to get under way this weekend and the course is being sculpted with bike jumps galore .
now entering its eighth year , organisers claim it 's one of the largest off-road events in uk .
at least 20,000 people are expected to see motorbikes , along with quad bikes and sidecars , take to the sand .
the event will take place between 10:30 and 18:00 on saturday and sunday and is free for all spectators .

documents.title: watch : cash machine ripped out of wall in north lincolnshire
text: a cash machine has been ripped out of the wall of a shop in north lincolnshire overnight .
it 's thought to have happened in the early hours at mccoll 's on crowle high street .
the a161 remains closed in both directions while the damage is cleared up .
a bbc look north viewer sent in this video :
author: Laura Foster
BBC Look North

documents.title: gp surgery to offer 'walk-in ' clinic
text: patients at a lincolnshire gp surgery will soon be able to see their doctor without making an appointment .
from december , glebe practice in saxibly will have a new walk-in clinic for patients with acute problems which need immediate medical attention .
the walk-in service near lincoln will operate between 08:00 and 09:30 and it will run on a first come , first served basis .
it 's hoped that this will free up pre-booked appointments for patients with other needs such as long term conditions and medicine reviews .
as well as patients registered at the saxibly surgery , it can also be used by patients registered in skellingthorpe .

documents.title: headlines this afternoon in lincolnshire
text: let 's take you through some of the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Charlotte Wright
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincolnshire 's 'ask for angela ' campaign goes national
text: a year after it was first created in lincolnshire , an innovative strategy aimed at helping people who feel uncomfortable or unsafe in bars and clubs is now being used around the uk .
created by hayley child from lincolnshire police , someone who feels uncomfortable can go to a bar and `` ask for angela '' and that will be treated as a discreet request for help .
ms child says it 's not always easy for someone to get out of an awkward situation , and this is a safe and subtle way of doing it .
as well as being used across lincolnshire , it 's now been introduced in several other towns and cities around the uk .
justin hudson , manager of butlers venue bar in gloucester , has seen the scheme in action after he introduced it at his bar :
a girl was out with a group , but her friends had left and she was left with a friend of a friend .
she did n't feel under threat and said , 'there 's no issues , but i 'd like to ask for angela ' .
the chap was in conversation with the door staff , so we whisked her away , put her in a taxi and sent her home .
she was home and safe within 10 minutes . ''

documents.title: lack of vitamin d putting health at risk
text: doctors in lincolnshire say they 're worried people are risking their health because they 're not getting enough of the so-called `` sunshine vitamin '' .
vitamin d keeps bones , teeth and muscles healthy , and deficiency is more common in the autumn and winter when there 's less sunshine .
in spring and summer , most people get all the vitamin d they need from sunshine , but it can also be found in oily fish , red meat , egg yolks and some spreads and cereals .
babies and people who are n't often outdoors are the most at risk of deficiency - particularly people who are frail or housebound .
dr radi sultan , from ingham surgery in lincoln , says people at risk should supplement their intake of the vitamin :
all of us would benefit from supplement .
we will be vitamin d deficient to varying levels in the winter , so the general advice is for supplementation in these seasons . ''

documents.title: talks held in bid to avoid northern rail strike
text: talks are being held today between rail operator northern and the rmt union in an effort to avoid strike action next week .
workers are expected to walk out next wednesday in an ongoing dispute over driver-only operated trains .
if the strike goes ahead , it will be the 11th day of industrial action on northern rail services this year .
northern runs services in the east midlands , yorkshire and the humber , the north east and the north west .

documents.title: first road safety summit begins in lincolnshire
text: lincolnshire 's first road safety summit is under way near grantham .

about 100 delegates from across the region are taking part , including the minister of state for transport and mp for south holland and the deepings john hayes , lincolnshire 's police and crime commissioner , members of lincolnshire road safety partnership , and first responders .
a number of initiatives are being showcased at the conference , including a scheme to give training for community volunteers to operate speed guns .

documents.title: re-opening of grantham a & e to be discussed next week
text: a decision to re-open grantham 's a & e overnight could be made by lincolnshire health bosses early next week .
the town ceased to have a 24-hour a & e service 15 months ago due to a shortage of doctors across lincolnshire .
since then , thousands of people have petitioned for its reopening , with several protests held and politicians on all sides calling for the overnight service to resume .
united lincolnshire hospitals trust says it has `` always remained committed to fully reopening the a & e as soon as it is safe to do so '' .

the trust adds that it 's been `` working hard '' to recruit and retain doctors , and it now has 22 middle-grade doctors - one more than the minimum needed to safely run the county 's three a & e units .
the trust board 's decision on tuesday will then be subject to approval from nhs improvement before any changes can be made .
author: David Sykes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincolnshire police show their respect
text: in the run-up to remembrance day , some police cars in lincolnshire are bearing red poppies .
they 've been specially added to the force 's cars at the county 's inaugural road safety summit near grantham :
addition to our @ twitterid livery today # proudtobelincs
one of those would great on the sgts car at skegness
coming your way , in the post to @ twitterid
will you have staff at the cenotaph in lincoln for the annual remembrance day service ?
yes , i believe so and at many of the dozens of events around # bombercounty
can i please ask where you got the vinyls from .
they look amazing .
would love to get some for our x5s .
cheers .
lee - dm me , i 'll send details
any of these on @ twitterid fleet ?
yes - should be there on monday
look forward to finding one for a # carselfie
respect .
none of this `` white '' poppy nonsense .
the uk has used the red poppy for years , as you well know , and it 's to remember the dead , as you know .
why should we change red to white ?
i must have misunderstood the news the other day when they were talking about people wanting to change from red to white poppy .
i apologise .
great stuff .
good to see .
at least one good policeman left .
respect to you sir
nicely done
respect
respect .
thank you .
it 's important for everyone who fought the war

documents.title: pedestrian dies after being hit by lorry on a52
text: a man has died after being hit by a heavy goods vehicle on the a52 last night .
the incident took place at 20.45 at butterwick .
the man , who has not yet been formally identified , was taken to the queen 's medical centre in nottingham where he died .
lincolnshire police are appealing for witnesses who saw the man walking on the a52 earlier that evening .

documents.title: bird flu warning for farmers
text: following outbreaks of avian influenza in parts of europe , farmers in lincolnshire are being asked to remain vigilant .
the risk of avian flu in wild birds has been raised to medium , although the risk for poultry remains low .
last december and january , more than 30,000 birds at poultry farms in lincolnshire were culled after three farms were infected .
charles row , a free range egg farmer near horncastle , says that apart from the welfare of the birds being severely compromised the financial implications are massive :
once you have a confirmed outbreak on your farm , the cleaning and disinfection that must go on , by order of the government , is significant .

documents.title: watch : today 's weather
text: a mostly dry day to come although it will be cloudier than yesterday .
watch my full forecast here :
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: welcome to friday 's live coverage
text: it 's friday at last !
i 'll be here until 18.00 with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather across lincolnshire .
we love to share your photos , stories or opinions , so if you 'd like to get in touch , drop me an email , or a message on facebook or twitter .
do n't forget , you can also listen to our live news bulletins on bbc radio lincolnshire every hour .
author: David Sykes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from our lincolnshire newsroom today , but we 'll be back tomorrow with live coverage from 08:00 .
meanwhile , this page will be updated overnight with all the latest breaking news and sport from across lincolnshire .
i 'll leave you with five things we did n't know this morning :
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: this evening 's lincolnshire weather forecast
text: a drizzly night ahead , with patches remaining into tomorrow .
however , it should become drier and brighter tomorrow afternoon with some sunny intervals developing :
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: hitting the high notes : song for lincolnshire countdown under way
text: preparations are under way for the song for lincolnshire competition which is being held in spalding tonight .
the annual competition pits local musicians against each other to compose songs about our fine county .
a free concert featuring live performances of all the finalists ' songs is due to take place tonight at the south holland centre in spalding .
the young 'uns ( who have won numerous bbc radio 2 folk awards , are also performing at the gig .

documents.title: magnificent murmuration : starlings in action over lincolnshire
text: a murmuration of starlings is always quite a sight , but what about this one against the backdrop of a lincolnshire sunset ?
photographer neil roberts caught this fantastic image of the starlings in action above grebe lake at the whisby nature park , near lincoln , last night .
although starlings live in this country all the year round , many thousands of the birds migrate from eastern europe in the winter to search for food .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: 'ground-breaking ' domestic abuse project awarded £ 1.4m
text: a project which aims to tackle domestic abuse has just been given a £ 1.4m grant from the government .
the project , co-organised by lincolnshire and sussex police , hopes to provide more support so authorities can intervene in abuse cases earlier .

the funding will help pay for specialist one-to-one services to change abusers ' behaviour , especially those who have n't been convicted of a crime , or who are at high risk of causing serious harm .

tackling domestic abuse is a high priority for the force and this ground-breaking project will reinforce the work we are already doing and ensure we work together at both local and national level . ''
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: arrest after robbery at lincolnshire watermill
text: a man has been arrested in connection with a robbery at a lincolnshire visitor attraction .
a couple were sat in their car outside cogglesford watermill in sleaford ( on wednesday when a man demanded money off them and escaped with a small amount of cash .
a 31-year-old local man has since been arrested on sus of robbery and is currently being interviewed , police say .
officers are appealing for people who were in the area at the time and may have seen what happened to get in touch .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : high-vis horseriding campaigner 's helicopter near-miss
text: a low swoop by a helicopter has made a lincolnshire woman realise how important high-vis jackets are while out horseriding in the countryside .
a helicopter almost flew right over sandra murphy and her friend at low altitude , risking spooking the horses :
a decade ago , sandra started a campaign to encourage riders to wear reflective jackets after two women died because of low flying helicopters .
she says this experience has reminded her how risky going out horseriding without high-vis clothing can be .
these are the things that give pilots that extra time , and could divert from having potentially lethal consequences . ''
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: mother describes lincolnshire murderer as 'disgusting animal '
text: the mother of an autistic 18-year-old who was killed by a lincolnshire woman has described the murderer and her accomplice as `` disgusting animals '' .
sharon pajich , whose son aaron was murdered before being buried in a shallow grave , says jemma lilley , who 's originally from stamford , deserves everything she gets for what she 's done .
lilley , 26 , has been convicted of murder alongside her 43-year-old housemate trudi lenon at the supreme court of western australia .
lenon told the court that lilley had approached the teenager as he installed games on her computer , garroted him and then stabbed him three times .
a jury found them both guilty within three hours .
they 're due to be sentenced in february .

documents.title: lorry driver admits causing fatal a1 crash
text: a lorry driver has pleaded guilty to killing a grantham man after driving dangerously on the a1 .
romanian national dorel galan , of london road , grays , essex , admitted causing the death of council worker ian newell , 52 , by driving his lorry recklessly on 9 march .
six vehicles were involved in the crash on the northbound carriageway of the a1 near newark , nottinghamshire .
mr newell was pronounced dead at the scene .
galan is due to be sentenced later .

documents.title: thatcher spitting image puppet returns
text: thatcher spitting image puppet returns

documents.title: sprout trailer breaks down in boston
text: boston may have voted strongly in favour of leaving the eu , but i 'm betting bostonians were n't expecting brussels to react this badly
a tractor and trailer containing a shipment of brussels sprouts has broken down on the liquorpond street roundabout in the town .
it 's causing severe delays on spalding rd and john adams way in the town .
yesterday , a trailer of cockles broke down at the same roundabout .
15:50 : cockle shells have been spilled by trailer on the a52 liquourpond roundabout , boston .
traffic being diverted - please avoid the area
you 'll need some mussels to shift that lot .
someone is going to shell out !
some shellfish lorry drivers on the road nowadays
that 's mary mary even more contrary now !
need some muscles to move them .
cockles and liquor must be someone 's ideal meal , somewhere maybe
the driver oyster know better !
driving standard must have been whelk below average !
will his mouths clam-med shut during the investigation ?
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: unions call for fairer pay for apprentices in yorkshire and humber
text: there are calls for apprentices in our region to be paid more money , with the yorkshire and humber tuc saying it 's unfair some apprentices are paid just £ 3.50 an hour .
it comes as a report by the young women 's trust is published which says two in five apprentices are spending more money completing their apprenticeships than they earn .
the government says apprentices ' pay has increased and apprenticeships can lead to higher earnings in the future .

documents.title: murder on 'bucket list ' of convicted lincolnshire woman
text: committing murder was on the `` bucket list '' of a 26-year-old lincolnshire woman who 's been convicted of murder after garroting , stabbing and burying the body of a teen in australia .

jemma lilley , who is originally from stamford , killed 18-year-old aaron pajich and buried him in a shallow grave covered with tiles and concrete at her home in perth , western australia , a court heard .

she said she wanted to kill someone before she turned 25 , and once she had ticked off murder from her `` bucket list '' she was so `` full of herself and euphoric '' that she could not help boasting to a work colleague , prosecutor james mctaggart told the court during the four-week trial .
lilley , who was convicted alongside 43-year-old housemate trudi lenon , is due to be sentenced on 23 february

documents.title: margaret thatcher spitting image puppet returns
text: a famous margaret thatcher puppet is on display in grantham after years in storage .
here 's the moment it showed its face after years under a sheet :
author: David Sykes
Reporter - BBC Lincolnshire

documents.title: breakingman dies after boat capsizes on river aire in leeds
text: a 60-year-old man from hull has died after a boat he was working on capsized on a river in leeds .
the man was taken to hospital in a serious condition after the incident on the river aire at thwaite gate in stourton on monday afternoon .
he was working with another man on the boat when it went over , he died yesterday evening in hospital .
police say they are continuing to work with the health & safety executive to establish the circumstances surrounding the incident .

documents.title: your lincolnshire headlines this lunchtime
text: a quick recap of the main stories in lincolnshire this lunchtime :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire News

documents.title: a stoatily fantastic start to the day at rspb frampton marsh
text: what a spot this morning by someone working for lincolnshire 's rspb !
it could be a stoat , or a small-tailed weasel
we can barely see it on the video , so how they saw it in real life at frampton marsh i do n't know :
up close , a stoat looks a little like this , by the way :
a stoatily different start to the morning @ # rspbframpton @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
cutest sight i 've seen of a stoat was a female crossing country lane with 6 babies in a line behind her .
sadly no camera handy
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: roadworks 'exacerbate ' lincoln level crossing problem - councillor
text: roadworks in lincoln may have `` exacerbated '' crowd problems at the city 's level crossing at the weekend , according to a lincolnshire councillor .
the roadworks meant there was limited space on the pavement , which caused crowds at peak shopping times on saturday :
lincolnshire county council decided not to postpone work on the roads nearby to avoid `` prolonging the agony for the people who use the area and visit the area '' .
councillor colin davie says : `` it 's better to get these works finished and get the whole thing properly opened again for the public and businesses . ''
network rail has done the right thing by planning to introduce attendants to manage the flow of pedestrians through the barriers at busy times , mr davie adds .
i share the frustration of the public in that that these works had to be done .
in addition to the railway bridge crossing , they have really exacerbated the problem . ''
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: afternoon tea for war vets in lincoln
text: eighty military veterans are due to enjoy a special afternoon tea in lincoln later organised to say `` thank you '' in the run up to remembrance day .
workers at morrisons in lincoln are hosting the event to bring together veterans who 've served in the armed forces .
ann davidson , a poppy appeal organiser , says in the past the event 's reunited people who 'd not met for decades .
we had two gentleman last year , both turned up to the evening tea , and they looked at each other , and recognised each .
they both lived in the lincoln area and neither of them had bumped into each other for 40 years , and yet they served together . ''
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: new appeal over missing lincolnshire teenager
text: police are appealing again for help in finding a 16-year-old student from lincolnshire who 's been missing from her home since last week .
chloe smith , from holbeach , was last seen at a college in peterborough on monday 30 october at about 12:20 .
she has links to peterborough , birmingham and bexley in london .
anyone with information about her whereabouts is being asked to contact lincolnshire police .

documents.title: cardiac arrest newsreader meets lifesavers
text: a bbc newsreader from lincolnshire has now met all the people who helped save her life a year ago after she suffered a cardiac arrest while out running .
charlotte wright , who works for bbc lincolnshire , had already met the passers-by who resuscitated her with life-saving cpr ( above ) .
but , she 's now met for the first time the 999 operator who took the call which saved her , and the paramedics who arrived at the scene .
i had this call through to say there 's a lady collapsed in uphill lincoln , we do n't think she 's breathing .
your mind then runs into the procedures .
the guy who was dealing with charlotte at the time was brilliant .
between us , charlotte 's here today and she 's proof that the system works . ''
the save a life campaign , which was inspired by charlotte , has now trained 18,000 people with cpr - or cardio-pulmonary resuscitation - skills .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : today 's weather
text: a mostly dry and bright start to the day across the region .
we 'll continue to see plenty of brightness and sunny spells today , here 's my full forecast .
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: patient care will not be jeopardised treatment move - hospitals trust
text: the trust that runs hospitals in grimsby , scunthorpe and goole says patient care wo n't be harmed by moving complex chemotherapy treatments from grimsby to castle hill near hull .
the decision was made by the north lincolnshire and goole nhs foundation trust who say the move is partly due to staff shortages .
cancer patients with the most complex needs will in future be sent to castle hill hospital in cottingham for their treatment .
it 's thought that around 70 people a year will be affected by these new arrangements .
outpatient and day case haematology appointments will continue to be offered as they are now at both scunthorpe and grimsby
author: Kimberley Metcalfe
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lincolnshire woman convicted of murdering autistic teen
text: a lincolnshire woman has been convicted of murdering an autistic teenager in australia .
jemma lilley , who 's originally from stamford , stabbed and buried 18-year-old aaron pajich at her home in perth in june last year .
the 26-year-old was convicted alongside 43-year-old housemate trudi lenon at the supreme court of western australia .
both are due to be sentenced in february .

documents.title: margaret thatcher puppet back on show in grantham
text: a puppet of former prime minister margaret thatcher is to be put back on display at grantham museum .

the puppet , from the 1980s and 1990s satirical sketch show spitting image , portrayed the then prime minister - who was from grantham - as a masculine woman who wore pinstripe suits and used urinals .
the puppet had been in storage at grantham 's museum , but is now back on display .
david burling , from the museum , says although the puppet made fun of the prime minister it has become a piece of history .
spitting image at the time was the first real thumb in the nose of authority on tv and i think it 's iconic itself .
some of the household names now , like ben elton and ian hislop , cut their teeth on spitting image .
the controversy is an interesting conversation , i want people to be able to have it , so let 's tell that story too . ''
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: 'dangerous ' crowds at level crossing spark safety fears
text: network rail say there 'll be attendants at lincoln 's level crossing this weekend because of safety concerns .
repair work on the footbridge means pavement space has been reduced and caused unusually large crowds waiting at the barriers (
one eyewitness said that the crowds had n't filtered through after waiting for one train before barriers came down for a second .
there 's another train coming before you 've all got through , so there 's still a mass of people on the line when the barriers are trying to come down .
you get so many that rush through and then the others have to just wait , but it is dangerous and nobody is monitoring it .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: new look for ashby market unveiled
text: the new-look ashby market opens to the public this morning in scunthorpe .
the council has invested £ 800,000 into the improvements .
some businesses were unable to move to the new market , but the council say the old one was only one-third occupied and the new one is already full :
author: Amanda White
BBC East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: welcome to thursday 's live coverage
text: good morning on this fine but foggy thursday , it 's harry here , bringing you the latest updates from our lincolnshire newsroom .
i 'll be bringing you news , sport , weather and travel from across the county until 18:00 today .
we love to hear from you , so get in touch by sending an email , or messaging on facebook or twitter .
send in your news or info about what 's happening where you are and we 'll try to include your contributions here .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: model debut for boy with down 's syndrome
text: model debut for boy with down 's syndrome

documents.title: stowaways from france found at airfield
text: stowaways from france found at airfield

documents.title: goodbye : five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it from me for today - we 'll be back in the morning from 08.00 with more live updates and breaking news , sport and travel will appear here throughout the night .
just before we head off , let 's look back at five things we discovered today :
bye for now !
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : cup run sparks imps baby boom
text: last season lincoln city were riding the crest of an fa cup and promotion wave , and it looks like it 's had a lasting effect on some fans ' lives
author: Rob Makepeace
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: appeal over theft of firefighters uniform
text: a strange one this .
police have issued an appeal for the safe return of a firefighter 's uniform that was stolen from a car in lincolnshire .
the uniform apparently went missing overnight between tuesday , october 17 and wednesday , october 18 from a car in commercial road , louth .

officers say it was branded with a london fire service logo , but it 's not clear whether the uniform was being used by a genuine firefighter , an enthusiast or someone else who might need a fireman 's uniform for their job .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: raf stowaways said they were from sudan
text: we were telling you earlier about three stowaways who were found hiding on an raf bus which had returned to lincolnshire from france .
the home office says the three men told them they were from sudan when immigration officers arrived at raf waddington on sunday .
in a statement a home office spokesman said : `` immigration enforcement was contacted by lincolnshire police on sunday 29 october after police officers attended an incident at raf waddington .
`` police officers arrested three men aged between 22 and 27 , who presented themselves as being from sudan .
`` the home office will progress their cases in accordance with immigration rules .
where someone has no right to remain in the uk , we will take action to remove them . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: photo finish : sunset provides perfect end to the day
text: you 've been sharing your of the sunset over lincolnshire this evening , as the county 's big skies put on a spectacular show .
here are a few of the best :
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: grimsby mp melanie onn seeks answers over cancer services
text: the mp for great grimsby melanie , onn wants to know why some cancer treatment are being moved miles away from grimsby to east yorkshire .
the northern lincolnshire and goole ( nlag ) hospitals trust is moving some cancer treatments to castle hill hospital in cottingham .
it 's because they have n't got enough consultants in haematology .
the chief executive of nlag , richard sunley , says the service has been fragile .
with annual leave and sickness taken into account its a fragile service .
now one of the two consultants has handed in their notice .
on that basis we are not able to continue running the service with just one consultant . ''
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: pm rules out reds replacement aircraft
text: the prime minister theresa may has told mps the red arrows wo n't get new aircraft until 2030 in a letter which has emerged today .
lincolnshire and yorkshire mps wrote to mrs may last month after it was announced bae systems , which makes the red arrows ' hawk jet was in difficulty .
it had been suggested that the government commission new hawk jets to fill a gap in orders caused by delays in deals on it 's other major aircraft the typhoon .
but mrs may has made it clear in the letter ( above ) the government does `` not need to take a decision on the replacement of the hawk t1 aircraft for many years to come '' .
author: Tim Iredale
Political editor, East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: shellfish driver blocks busy roundabout
text: this just in from lincolnshire police - looks like it could be a messy rush hour in boston :
15:50 : cockle shells have been spilled by trailer on the a52 liquourpond roundabout , boston .
traffic being diverted - please avoid the area
you 'll need some mussels to shift that lot .
someone is going to shell out !
some shellfish lorry drivers on the road nowadays
need some muscles to move them .
cockles and liquor must be someone 's ideal meal , somewhere maybe
that 's mary mary even more contrary now !
lol
the driver oyster know better !
driving standard must have been whelk below average !
will his mouths clam-med shut during the investigation ?

documents.title: foreign stowaways discovered on raf bus
text: three foreign nationals were discovered on a coach which ended up at an raf station at the weekend , police have confirmed .
the trio were discovered on sunday at raf waddington , on board a coach which was bringing air force personnel back from france .
a lincolnshire police statement says : `` on october 29 , three civilian foreign nationals were detained at raf waddington and handed to lincolnshire police .
`` these individuals are believed to have arrived on a coach returning raf personnel from force development activity in france .
`` lincolnshire police detained the individuals and handed them to home office immigration officials . ''
it 's not clear whether those detained are men or women , or where they are now .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: can you help find missing lisa ?
text: police say they are worried for the safety of a woman who 's gone missing from her home in skegness .
lisa hartshorne , who 's 30 , has n't been seen since 30 october at about 15:45 .
anyone with information about her whereabouts is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: watch : police still searching modern slavery site
text: here 's some more video from drinsey nook , at saxilby , near lincoln - where police have raided a traveller site .
the site 's linked to operation pottery - a long-running investigation into modern slavery run by lincolnshire police since 2014 :
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: batman sex attacker wanted by police
text: detectives are looking for a man who attacked a woman last night while wearing a batman costume .
police say the assault happened in lumley road , skegness between 20:15 and 21:30 .
the victim 's told police she set off a personal attack alarm and officers say they are keen to hear from anyone who may have heard it .
any information should be passed to dc dave patten , from the specialist sex assault emerald team , by calling 101 .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather : some sunshine this afternoon
text: lincolnshire will be dry with sunny spells this afternoon .
it may turn rather cloudier across northern areas through the evening :
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: here are the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom so far today :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire News

documents.title: watch : police raid continues at modern slavery traveller site
text: here 's a video from the drinsey nook traveller site - which is at the centre of new police raid this lunchtime .
the site at saxilby , near lincoln , was home to members of the rooney family who were jailed in september as part of modern day slavery operation known as operation pottery .
lincolnshire police say that although offenders are in custody , the investigation continues , and a 26-year-old man has now been arrested on sus of a number of charges .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: slavery traveller site raid : police statement
text: we 've now heard from lincolnshire police about the raid on the drinsey nook traveller site at saxilby , near lincoln , this lunchtime .
officers say they have arrested a 26-year-old man on sus of a number of offences .

the site ( below ) was at the centre of a modern slavery investigation called operation pottery which ran from 2014 to september this year , when nine members of the rooney family were jailed for keeping people as slaves .
a police spokesman told the bbc : `` we have carried out a search warrant this morning at drinsey nook in connection with our operation pottery investigation .
`` although defendants are now serving sentences , we are now investigating possible offences of fraud , money laundering and proceeds of crime .
`` we will update on this investigation when we are in a position to do so .

officers , who remain on site , are being assisted by nottinghamshire and leicestershire police , the department for work and pensions , west lindsey district council and newark and sherwood council .
`` a 26-year old man has been arrested on sus of participating in organised crime , money laundering and theft . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: police presence at modern slavery traveller site
text: there 's a major police presence this lunchtime at a traveller site which was at the centre of a human slavery court case earlier this year .
police are at the drinsey nook traveller site , saxilby , near lincoln , as the taken by my colleague alex rhodes , show .
nine members of a family linked with the site were jailed at nottingham crown court in september for modern day slavery offences .
lincolnshire police has not yet given any details about this operation .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: two 999 services to share one station
text: louth fire station has become the new home for the ambulance service in the town .
from today , the new shared site will see both lincolnshire fire and rescue and east midlands ambulance crews operating from eastfield road .

it comes as work continues on a new shared station in sleaford , and plans progress for a so-called `` blue-light hub '' which will house police , fire and ambulance on south park in lincoln city centre .
author: David Sykes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: new red arrows line-up
text: the new red arrows line-up for next year has been revealed with three new pilots .
the team have begun training for 2018 - which will be the royal air force 's 100th anniversary year .
flight lieutenants jon bond and david stark ( middle and right above ) are joining as reds 2 and 3 respectively .
and it 's a return to the team for squadron leader martin pert ( far left above ) who is the new red 1 .
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: humber bridge reunion for engineers who helped build it
text: the humber bridge board is hosting a reunion of more than 20 engineers who helped construct the bridge .
phil kirk ( above ) was a trainee engineer when the humber bridge was being built .
he says there was a lack of safety measures at the time .
the event 's been organised by two former workers to mark the structure 's grade i listing , awarded this year .
they 've travelled from as far away as australia to celebrate together and will take a trip up the hessle tower before a civic lunch and tour of the city of culture .
author: Jo Makel
BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : dry with sunny spells today
text: it 's looking like a decent day today with some sunshine to come .
here 's my full forecast :
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: public meeting today after locals kick up stink over meat plant
text: a company which wants to build a meat by-products factory in a village near lincoln is holding a public consultation on the plan today .
nearly 3,000 people have signed a petition against the £ 28m scheme in norton disney .
it 's claimed the plant will cause smells and congestion if it 's built .
norton disney residents also say a plant owned by the same firm in the nearby village of skellingthorpe had caused that community to be dubbed `` smelly skelly '' .
lincoln proteins limited , which is behind the scheme , says new machinery will mean there 'll be no odours .
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: lettings boards 'an eyesore ' council claims
text: the number of lettings boards in lincoln is becoming a problem according to council officials who have launched a consultation on getting rid of them .
the city of lincoln council says a quarter of properties in some city neighbourhoods display a 'to let ' board - and it 's becoming an eyesore .
the council says some boards stay up all year round - and in today 's internet age many people search online rather than walking the streets to look for property .
we would normally go online - the amount of opportunistic business which arises from lettings boards i would suspect is very small ''
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: m & s creates 50 new jobs on its return to resort
text: high street giant marks and spencer is opening its latest lincolnshire store today .
the firm pulled out of skegness high street several years ago .
its new venture is on a retail park built on the former skegness town football ground .
the firm says the new food hall - which opens at 10.00 - will create up to 50 jobs for local people .
it comes around a fortnight after aldi opened a new store at the same location .
author: Scott Dalton
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: mp calls for northern lincolnshire health services to be protected
text: a north east lincolnshire mp says it 's important that nhs services are protected on the south bank of the humber .
it comes after the trust which runs hospitals in grimsby , scunthorpe and goole announced that some cancer treatments will be moved to east yorkshire , because of staff shortages .
the cleethorpes mp martin vickers is hoping it is n't a permanent move :
the trust are doing their best to recruit people .
my colleagues and i will do all we can to support them .
what we want to ensure is that local services are retained whenever possible . ''
author: Vicky Johnson
BBC Look North

documents.title: welcome to wednesday 's live coverage
text: good morning from lincoln .
i 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county until 18.00 today .
we love to hear from you , so get in touch by sending an email , or messaging on facebook or twitter .
send in your news or info about what 's happening where you are and we 'll try to include your contributions here .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: goodbye : five things we 've learned today
text: so that 's it from me and the team in lincoln for today - i 'm off to hide from the trick or treaters who will be out and about this evening .
we 'll be back tomorrow from 08.00 with all the latest updates from across lincolnshire , but breaking news and sport will continue to appear right here during the night .
just before i head off into the halloween night , there 's time to look back at five things we 've discovered today :
bye for now !
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : some cloud but a dry evening
text: a cloudy evening to start with , but increasingly clear with temperatures in double figures .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: pictures released after 'disorder ' in boston
text: detectives in boston have released these images showing two men and a woman who may be able to help with an investigation into `` disorder '' in the town last week :
the incident happened on west street in the early hours of sunday 22 october .
if you know who they are , or saw anything on the night , you 're being asked to get in touch with police .

documents.title: cancer services changes blamed on staff shortages
text: some cancer patients in north east lincolnshire will have to travel to hull for treatment after a decision made this afternoon by the trust which runs hospitals in grimsby , scunthorpe and goole .
the northern lincolnshire and goole nhs foundation trust says staff shortages means moving complex chemotherapy work to castle hill in hull will help to provide a safe service .
the changes are expected to affect about 70 patients every year , the trust says .
the arrangement is initially temporary but , subject to public consultation , could be made permanent , it adds .
we have long-established links with castle hill and our aim is to ensure local cancer patients receive the quality care they need .
this change to the service will affect patients receiving haematological care from the trust , but it will mean their more complex care needs will be met at a centre of excellence . ''
author: Vicky Johnson
BBC Look North

documents.title: traffic and travel : broken down vehicles cause bypass jams
text: there have been delays on the a46 lincoln bypass both north and southbound this afternoon after vehicles broke down on both sides of the dual carriageway .
police are at the scene - but it could cause problems if you 're leaving the city this evening .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: 'ice ' way to raise cash for lincoln park 's restoration
text: earlier this year it was announced that an ice rink which had been a festive fixture in lincoln city centre over the past few christmases would n't be returning this year .
but there 'll now be a chance to get out those skates anyway - this time in one of the city 's parks .
and it 's all to raise money for its restoration .
boultham park ( which is owned by city of lincoln council , is being made over as part of a deal with the charity the linkage trust .
the ice rink will be in the park on saturday 2 and sunday 3 december , with all profits going towards the park restoration fund .

documents.title: british steel workers seek compensation over health problems
text: people who worked at british steel between the 1950s and 80s could get compensation for health problems they got from working at its coking plants .
the high court has appointed solicitors to look at the case .
hundreds of people have been potentially affected by exposure to dust and fumes , including those who worked at the firm 's scunthorpe plant .
british steel says it knows about the claims but ca n't comment further :

we are aware of these claims , which arise from alleged exposure to dust and fumes during the course of employment , mainly between the 1950s and 1980s , at various coke ovens throughout england , wales and scotland .
as legal proceedings are ongoing , it would be inappropriate for us to comment further at this time . ''

documents.title: traffic and travel : a46 closed after crash
text: the a46 is closed in both directions at the moment after a crash involving a lorry , van and car between faldingworth and middle rasen .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: cctv appeal in louth fraud investigation
text: this cctv has just been released by police showing a man officers want to speak to as part of a fraud inquiry in louth which dates back to the summer :
police say bank and identification cards were stolen from a changing room locker in august .
officers believe this man could help them with their investigation .
anyone with information or who can identify the man in the is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: leaving eu 'could be good for pig farmers '
text: a pig farmer from scunthorpe believes pork production could improve when the uk leaves the eu in 17 months .
more than a quarter of the uk 's pork imports come from denmark and new tariffs could be introduced which will make it more expensive to import food in to the country .
with that in mind , sally jackson , from the pink pig farm , says by increasing import tariffs british farmers will see an increase in value :
with the right negotiating tactics we should be able to get a good deal for british farmers in the eu .
they need our exports as much as we need their imports . ''
author: Paul Murphy
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: seven in court on boston murder charge
text: seven men have appeared at lincoln crown court accused of murdering a 44-year-old man in boston .
alberts volkausks ( was found with serious injuries at a property in pen street on saturday 23 september and died later in hospital .
six of the seven defendants entered not guilty pleas to the murder charge .

they are pavel grunt-meyer , 29 , of crocketts drive , wisbech ; denis kijakovskij , 27 , of london road , wyberton ; mindaugas cerneckas , 29 , of pen street , boston ; andrius barauskas , 39 , of smalley road , boston ; tautvydas vainolavicius , 19 , of pen street , boston , and marjus tomasevic , 18 , of pen street , boston .
the seventh defendant , donatos dektiariovas , 36 , of pen street , boston , was not asked to enter a plea to the murder charge .
the trial is expected to last eight weeks .
judge john pini qc remanded all seven men back in to custody .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live

documents.title: are you hare aware ?
text: i 'm in sleaford today on the trail of a drove of hares ( yes that 's the right collective noun ) .
they 're made out of mud and have been placed around the town - one of them is below .
they 've been made by artists who are trying to raise awareness of the problem of hare coursing in the county .
i 'll have more tonight on bbc look north at 18.30 .
author: Gemma Dawson
BBC Look North

documents.title: weather : a dry and cool afternoon to come
text: here 's the forecast you 'll need it you 're heading out this afternoon :
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: here are the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: premier league surgeon signs for grantham hospital
text: he 's treated premier league footballers and now he 's joined the team at grantham hospital
orthopaedic consultant surgeon paul lee is to treat patients from across the county and says he sees big potential to improve services .
mr lee 's been speaking on bbc radio lincolnshire and has talked about his work with some famous footballers .
he 's treated several big names for muscle injuries which significantly reduced their time for recovery and return to play .
he says he now has high hopes for grantham hospital :
it 's in a unique location with great potential to develop into a centre of excellence .
with the support of digital technology , we will be able provide cutting-edge world class care for our patients . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: gp surgery could be saved by patient power
text: a doctor 's surgery threatened with closure in lincoln could be saved thanks to overwhelming support from patients .
a consultation 's been running on the future of the gresham street surgery in the west end of the city - and the overwhelming response from the public was to keep the site open .
health managers say they hope to award a new contract to run the site from next april .

the feedback from our meetings and information submitted through our online survey highlighted that providing services from both burton road and gresham street surgeries would best support patients to have a continuity of care . ''
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: passenger numbers soar at airport
text: if you flew from east midlands airport on your holidays this year and it was busier than before - there 's an explanation .
the site has had its busiest summer in almost a decade , with more than three million passengers flying from the airport since may , the highest number since 2008 .
bosses say they ultimately want to see 10 million people a year passing through the terminal .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: warning after spate of kitchen fires
text: firefighters in lincolnshire say they 've been called to six house fires in the last three days - all linked to cooking or cookers being left unattended .
it 's prompted them to issue a safety warning , with homes in gainsborough , boston , saxilby , grantham and langtoft among those affected .
in one of the fires in gainsborough the owner had cleaned the cooker but left cleaning fluid inside , which caught fire when the oven was switched on .
as soon as you 've finished cooking , make sure you turn off the appliances .
also , make it part of your routine before you go to bed or leave the house to double check all cookers are off .
kitchen fires can be easily prevented with a bit of common sense . ''
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: campaigners call for public meetings over possible fracking
text: campaigners in lincolnshire are calling for public meetings with the authorities to discuss concerns about fracking .
fracking is the process of drilling down into the earth before a high-pressure water mixture is directed at rock to release the gas inside .
opponents say it can cause water contamination , earthquakes and vehicles going to and from the site could lead to noise and traffic pollution .
the frack free lincolnshire group says it believes a company is preparing to begin the fracking process on two sites near louth .
but the company , egdon resourcing , says has no plans - or the correct licences - and only plans to extract oil using conventional methods .
lincolnshire county council , which would issue a licence for fracking to take place , also says none have been granted .
author: David Sykes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: shock as church charity boxes stolen
text: the rector of boston stump says she 's shocked after thieves stole a number of collection boxes from the church .
charity tins for the poppy appeal and the raf association have been taken - along with the church 's large donations box ( below ) .
i feel very sad for the person who 's done it , that they feel they have to do that , they obviously are desperate .
but i also feel incredibly sad for us - we are collecting for other charities and the royal british legion and we know how important that is to them .
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: communities to get radar guns to curb speed
text: lincolnshire 's police and crime commissioner will give out speed guns as part of a new bid to reduce speeding on the county 's roads .
the police already supply signs and other equipment to communities to help them get their speeding message across .
but in a measure to be unveiled at his first road safety summit on friday , mr jones will say he will now supply speed guns to allow residents to catch drivers in the act .
offenders wo n't be given fines , but will be sent letters to say they have been caught and offering road safety advice .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : rain dying out leaving a dry afternoon
text: any light rain we 're seeing this morning will soon disappear .
here 's my full forecast :
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: welcome to tuesday 's live coverage
text: good morning from lincoln .
i 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county until 18.00 today .
we love to hear from you , so get in touch by sending an email , or messaging on facebook or twitter .
send in your news or info about what 's happening where you are and we 'll try to include it here .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it from me today .
we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow , bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across lincolnshire as it happens .
for now , i 'll leave you with five things we 've learned on our journey through the day :
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincolnshire 's evening weather forecast
text: you can really tell the clocks ' have gone back , it 's already very dark
weather-wise , it 's going to get increasingly cloudy as we head into the evening , though milder than yesterday night :
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: lincolnshire singer makes it through first x factor live show
text: lincolnshire singer jack remington is safely through the first stage of live shows for the x factor .
jack ( left ) , who is originally from gainsborough and who is part of the jack and joel duo , made it through last night 's public vote and is due to perform again next weekend .
he says it 's been a rollercoaster :
when simon [ cowell ] sat in on the dress rehearsal that was nerve-wracking because that 's the first time we'e seen him since judges houses when he said 'no ' .
then suddenly the public voted us back in and we 're trying to prove to him they 've done the right thing it was a lot of pressure , but he said he really liked the song . ''

documents.title: are fireworks set to get quieter ?
text: a petition started by a lincolnshire woman calling for tighter restrictions around fireworks has gathered more than 21,000 signatures in less than three weeks .
julie doorne , from sleaford , says many people and animals can be badly affected by the unexpected loud explosions - especially around bonfire night .

but sally bates , who runs an east yorkshire-based fireworks and organised displays company , says this year fireworks have been re-regulated to a european standard - with all noise levels controlled and products inspected on import .
she adds that she 's keen to develop displays which are considered quieter , including using music or quieter fireworks :
i 'm working with our suppliers to encourage them to source better , more spectacular products which are all quiet .
we work in a lot of venues which have animals and all of these venues are requesting this from us . ''
author: Louise Wheeler
Reporter, BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : fancy joining the lincolnshire bombers ?
text: the success of american football is boosting the popularity of nfl in lincolnshire , it seems .
the lincolnshire bombers held a recruitment day at the weekend :
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: poppy collection tins stolen from boston stump
text: some collection tins have been stolen from boston stump and staff there are now asking for them to be returned :
in a second tweet , they add : `` the money is replaceable - but this fantastic historic box with so much sentimental value is not .
please please can we have it back ! ''
we have had 2 poppy collection tins stolen , 1 rafa collection tin stolen and this beautiful and very large donations box .
the money is replaceable - but this fantastic historic box with so much sentimental value is not .
please please can we have it back !
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
i think everyone knows the nationality of the people that did this .
but dare not say .
let 's hope they go to hell in a handcart !
is nothing sacred !
this is awful !
# randomobvioustweet
is anything sacred today ?
i despair !
happy to do this , but i do n't want to presume on the part of the church .
it does n't undo anything , but we could set up a gofundme toward having a craftsman produce a new box or donations if the original is found .
an amazing historic box .
i so hope it is recovered .
this tweet seems familiar
that is awful sleezy .
hopefully the box is now too hot to move on .
if they have any decency left ( debateable ) leave it somewhere safe where it can be returned
omg thats disgusting what 's the matter with people thease days scum they are
cctv ?
sad world we live in
no words .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: flashmob hits grimsby town match
text: a secret flashmob erupted in the middle of this weekend 's grimsby town match against cambridge united , much to the delight of the 4,000 fans at the stadium :
over 150 volunteers were involved in the flashmob which was aimed at showing support for grimsby town 's sport and education trust and the equality practice :
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: becky the crocodile lands in lincolnshire
text: a lincolnshire wildlife park is welcoming a new resident .
the ark at stickney , near boston , has rescued becky , a 4ft long mexican crocodile .
she 's come from a centre in kent which can no longer look after her .
lincolnshire 's seb tiley was there to see her arrival :
becky the crocodile arrives at her new home , @ twitterid !
more on @ twitterid !

documents.title: sleaford woman launches petition to tighten firework use
text: a woman from lincolnshire says she 'll continue her campaign asking for a change in the law on fireworks .
julie doorne , from sleaford , has set up a petition for tougher restrictions on the use of fireworks saying they cause distress and suffering to animals .
as well as animals , julie says lots of people can be affected by the unexpected loud explosions such as those with autism , anxiety and post-traumatic stress disorder .
after three weeks , her petition has reached over 20,000 signatures .
two years ago , she launched another petition and when it reached 100,000 signatures it was debated in parliament , with the government rejecting calls to change the law .
she 's calling on the government to start collecting statistics from all emergency services to understand the size of the problem and to only have displays on certain days so people can prepare :

traditional fireworks are fantastic - fireworks night , new year 's eve , diwali , chinese new year - everyone can prepare for those if they 've got dogs that are frightened and if they 've got elderly relatives that may be scared but if you 've do n't know when they 're going to happen how are you supposed to prepare for them ? ''
author: Jake Zuckerman
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: lincolnshire 's high-tech businesses in spotlight
text: the head of siemens says businesses in lincolnshire and the rest of the country , need to embrace technology to be successful in the future .
juergen maier says advanced digital technologies including robotics and artificial intelligence can create jobs and boost the economy .
the lincolnshire local enterprise partnership recently revealed there 's been a 20 % rise in the number of high-tech firms in the county .
what we 're looking to do is champion the creators and the makers of our nation and , through that , create prosperity . ''
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: girl , 16 , in court on attempted murder charge
text: a 16-year-old girl has appeared in court charged with the attempted murder of a school welfare worker in scunthorpe .
joy simon , 61 , was attacked in an office at winterton community academy on monday 25 september .
the girl , who can not be named for legal reasons , appeared at hull crown court earlier .
no plea was entered and another hearing is scheduled for 27 november .
the trial is set for 11 december .
author: Laura Foster
Reporter, BBC Look North

documents.title: do you want to help celebrate 100 years of the raf in lincolnshire ?
text: volunteers to help with two new exhibitions celebrating 100 years of the raf in lincolnshire are being sought ahead of their launch next year .
the collection in lincoln and raf scampton are both set to showcase lincolnshire 's role in defending the country from the air .
the exhibition at raf scampton will run from 6 april until 24 august , while the exhibition at the collection will be open from 26 may until 9 september .
dave harrigan , from lincolnshire county council , says volunteers are wanted to `` share their passion for aviation heritage '' with the thousands of visitors expected to come along .
the raf 100 events will be one the biggest celebrations of aviation heritage ever seen , so this really is a chance to be a part of something special . ''
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: street lights switch-off : 'communities do n't feel safe '
text: a review into lincolnshire 's overnight street lights switch-off is due to be held this week .
county councillors are expected to assess the impact of turning off thousands of street lights between midnight and 06:00 .
any changes which emerge from this review need to be cost-neutral because savings still need to be made , according to the council .
sarah dodds , deputy leader of the labour group on the county council , says at the moment many people are n't happy with the switch-off :
you can not put a price on communities feeling safe and communities feeling comfortable and it is very , very clear from talking to members of the public that they do n't . ''

documents.title: b1189 roadworks begin
text: four weeks of roadworks have begun in metheringham .
a stretch of the b1189 will be closed overnight from 19:00 - 06:00 monday to friday while the resurfacing and reconstruction works take place .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lunchtime weather
text: it 'll remain chilly with sunny skies continuing until later this afternoon , before cloud spreads in from the west .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: the top stories so far today from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire News

documents.title: call for 'consistency ' over ivf treatment
text: none of the clinical commissioning groups ( ccgs ) in east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire offer couples the government 's recommended three cycles of ivf treatment on the nhs , it 's emerged .
three of the four ccgs only offer one round of ivf , a bbc investigation has found .
in hull , it 's two and you can apply for a third , but only if you go through a funding review .
campaigners argue that infertility is a disease and everyone should have access to three cycles of ivf on the nhs , regardless of where they live .
there needs to be consistency .
there 's so much difference between the postcodes in the last two or three years .
i 've had friends from the same area who did n't get funding . ''
author: Victoria Holland
BBC Look North

documents.title: traffic and travel : delays in horncastle
text: traffic is currently queuing in both directions at horncastle .
it 's on the a158 jubilee way at b1191 west street in the roadworks area .
drivers are being warned to avoid the area if possible and to expect some delays in the area .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: weather watchers : golden lincolnshire sunset caught on camera
text: it 's a lovely sunny day here in lincoln , if a little cold .
and last night we had this beautiful orange sky sent in from our bbc weather watcher woldscyclist in binbrook .
i guess the saying about red sky at night , shepherd 's delight may well be true !
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: witness appeal after gainsborough ram-raid
text: detectives are appealing for witnesses to a ram-raid at a shop in gainsborough at the weekend .
a car was driven into the front of the heron foods store in the market place on saturday night .
the atm was targeted and the vehicle later crashed into parked cars .
the robbers crashed their getaway car and fled from the scene on foot .
author: David McKenna
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: investigations following fatal car crash
text: investigations are continuing after a car crash in north lincolnshire that killed two men and injured four others .
it happened on the a1077 between south ferriby and barton on friday night , when a vauxhall astra crashed with an audi tt .
the two men travelling in a vauxhall astra suffered fatal injuries , with another man suffering life-threatening injuries .
two other men in the car were seriously injured .
the driver of the other car suffered serious , non life-threatening injuries .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: north lincolnshire 's patient transport service examined
text: a review of how patient transport is run in north lincolnshire is due to be held today .
the council 's scrutiny panel will look at the service , which is run by the thames ambulance service .
recently there 's been a dispute between the company and its volunteer drivers over how expenses are paid .
new rules mean drivers wo n't be paid for fuel on the way to their first job or returning from their last .
it has meant a number of volunteer drivers have stopped transporting patients to and from appointments .
some patients using the service have told bbc look north they 've been left waiting hours for people to them up from appointments .
thames ambulance says the changes were needed in order to put the terms and conditions in line with other drivers at the company .

documents.title: streetlights review begins this week
text: a decision to switch off lincolnshire 's street lights overnight will be reviewed from this week .
in a bid to save money thousands of lights are currently turned off between midnight and 06.00 .
a major review will begin this week , looking into the impact on crime , emergency services and businesses and you will be invited to share your thoughts .
john jackson , from sutton bridge , cycles to work in the dark every day , he says a change ca n't come soon enough :
generally in the winter time it is pitch black .
it 's generally unsafe .
i never bike on the road , not anymore .
they 've clipped me with their mirrors twice so i stay on the pavement now .
someone will eventually get hurt down this road with these lights off .
author: Seb Tiley
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: search for new boston united manager begins
text: boston united have set a deadline of friday tea-time for applications for the manager 's job .
the pilgrims are looking for a new boss after adam murray resigned at the weekend .
adam has worked extremely hard during his time at boston united , not only with his commitment to the first team , but also the club as a whole .
it is very sad that his dedication has not resulted in the progression of the first team that we all hoped for and we reluctantly accepted his resignation .
boston are second bottom of national league north after a string of poor results .
assistant boss and striker karl hawley will take temporary charge for the match against salford city tomorrow night .
author: Rob Makepeace
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: lincolnshire couples not receiving full course of ivf treatment
text: now you may know that the government recommends three cycles of the fertility treatment ivf on the nhs .
well , here in lincolnshire people are only being offered one .
an investigation by the bbc has found the number of clinical commissioning groups ( ccgs ) in england offering three ivf cycles to women under 40 has halved in the past five years .
campaigners argue that infertility is a disease and everyone should have access to three cycles of ivf on the nhs , regardless of where they live .
the lincolnshire west ccg which oversees nhs ivf funding for the county has responded :
the decision was made in 2013 based on population full health needs assessments by the ccgs within the region .
clinical opinion agreed it was appropriate , given other nhs healthcare demands , that one cycle of ivf treatment was funded by the nhs .
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : today 's weather
text: it 's a cold , frosty start for many .
sunny skies are likely to be around for much of the day , before cloud spreads in from the west during the afternoon .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: welcome to monday 's live coverage
text: good morning and welcome to the start of another week !
it 's hope here , i 'll be bringing you news , sport , weather and travel from across the county as it happens .
got something happening near you today ?
well we love to hear from you , you can get in touch via facebook , twitter or email .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire
